title: [K-12] Microlearning Simulation for Strengthening Civic Competencies to Prevent Online Violence: Rights-Based and Social Responsibility Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of psychology and pedagogy, digital literacy, foundational understanding of school violence prevention systems, and elementary awareness of civic rights and social responsibility
context.additional_context: An online violence prevention competency enhancement program for pre-service teachers, optimized for smartphones to address environments without PC access. Designed to foster citizenship and enhance human rights sensitivity in educational settings, with a focus on strengthening civic participation capabilities for solving community issues.

learning_goals: Learners explain a four-stage intervention model for online violence (awareness-responsibility-intervention-follow-up) with 85% accuracy and demonstrate the ability to interpret social relationships from civic rights and human sensitivity perspectives.
Learners apply citizenship-enhancing intervention strategies based on social relationship analysis in simulation scenarios for three consecutive successful attempts.

Learners select one community issue (e.g., illegal dumping, school safety), conduct case studies in teams of 3â€“4, write 3-page project reports with three prevention strategies, and propose one institutional improvement plan from a civic participation perspective for local administrative agencies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
